name: Nata Lodge
description: LOCATION & ACCESS: Nata Lodge is an oasis set among the Mokolwane Palms on the edge of the Makgadikgadi Salt Pans. The lodge is ideally situated close to the entrance of the Nata Bird Sanctuary, is just off the main road and 10km south of Nata Village. This is the junction to the Okavango, Chobe National Park, Victoria Falls Zimbabwe/ Zambia and Francistown areas. ACCOMMODATION: Nata Lodge offers 22 Luxury thatched chalets built on stilts and set in rustic African style, with bathroom en-suite including indoor bath and outdoor shower and now boats air-conditioning. 10 custom designed meru tents set on wooden decks with en suite bathroom and outdoor showers. All our beds are of twin bed configuration. 2 Family Chalets to accommodate 4 pax ( twin beds and bunk bed) and 1 Chalet has been built to accommodate not only the physically challenged but also those guests who require easier access to the shower and toilet. Our camping site boasts stylish semi open ladies and gents ablution facilities with hot and cold showers. FACILITIES: 50 - seater indoor restaurant with open air patio. Continental and English breakfast with buffets served over busy periods. Lunches consist of a patio/terrace menu with some of the old favorites and some new ones. Dinner menus vary between a la carte and traditional African buffet/ braais on busy occasions. The bar area overlooks our crystal blue swimming pool and offers a wide range of ice cold refreshments. Curio shop offers African crafts, jewellery, reading material, maps and clothing. Onward booking facility for accommodation and activities on the Chobe River as well as at Victoria Falls and the Okavango Delta. ACTIVITIES: Activities on offer are quad biking around the dusty tracks of the pans and surrounding areas and exploring the Nata Bird Sanctuary in our open 4x4 safari vehicles. From fully furnished, air-conditioned chalets and hotel rooms to the picturesque river-facing campsite with ablutions there is an extensive range of accommodation to suit any budget. With its African décor, welcoming staff and friendly atmosphere, The Sedia Hotel also boasts excellent amenities including a fully equipped function room, a large swimming pool with terrace bar, and expansive gardens with a jungle gym for the little ones. During the day, the shaded teak-decked poolside terrace provides a relaxed space where you can enjoy a drink or light refreshment. Once the sun goes down, ambient lighting and pleasant background music create an atmospheric and social setting while still allowing space for those wishing to enjoy more privacy.

name: Wilderness Abu Camp
description: Meet Your Inner Elephant. At Abu Camp, you are invited to immerse yourself in the majestic world of the African elephant and to see the African bush and its wildlife through the eyes of the elephants – by joining the Abu herd. You will form a strong emotional bond with the herd that is both humbling and inspiring and at the same time, gain an understanding of elephant conservation – the premise on which Abu Camp is based. Named after a very special bull elephant, Abu Camp is set in a pristine copse of riverine forest and blends in seamlessly with the magnificent surrounding hardwood trees. Looking out over a large lagoon, an imaginative use of canvas has created a unique and luxurious style of tent. Each of the six en-suite tents has its own distinctive furnishings and fittings, imparting an air of opulence in the bush, and featuring an indoor and outdoor shower, an outdoor copper bath and a plunge pool sunk into the elevated teak deck.

name: Nxai Pan
locationString: Nxai Pan National Park, Central District
description: Nxai Pan is located on the western edge of the fossil pan from which the camp takes its name. The camp faces east over the open grasslands of the pans. The biggest draw to Nxai Pan National Park are the zebras that migrate by the thousands to the area – the second largest land animal migration in Southern Africa. Day trips to Baines’ Baobabs are highly popular, and include a picnic lunch at the site. These age-old trees were immortalised in paintings by the artist and adventurer Thomas Baines in 1862. Another classic activity at Nxai Pan is a walk with one of the San bushmen trackers, an informative walk that takes place within the camp’s footprint. Learn about how the San used to live nomadically: how they used to hunt, gather food, water sources, and which plants were used for medicinal purposes. Their wealth of true bush knowledge is unparalled, and one of our guests’ favourite experiences at our desert camps.

Located in the Kwa Tuli Private Game Reserve we have an exclusive area in excess of 6000 hectares available to make our game drives and spectaculair bush walks. Encounter elephant, hyena or leopard on foot or wander through the undisturbed riverine forests with its abundant birdlife and flora. Our luxury tents are positioned in such a way that they provide ultimate privacy for our guests and optimum views of its surrounding. name: Pelo Camp
locationString: Moremi Game Reserve, Okavango Delta, North-West District
description: The word Pelo means 'heart' - a fitting name as, from the air, the island on which Pelo Camp is situated is heart-shaped. It is also found pretty much as deep into the heart of the Okavango Delta as it is possible to be. The camp is completely eco-friendly with solar power providing all energy requirements. The main area comprises a tented dining area and lounge situated under impressive wild date palms, jackalberry and Natal mahogany trees with a spacious deck overlooking the waterways. There is also a swimming pool, an outdoor boma area and a raised platform built onto an old anthill. Small and intimate, the five spacious guest tents have en-suite bathrooms and a covered front veranda with an outdoor bucket style shower. Given the camp's situation on an exquisite, small island surrounded by permanent water, activities focus on mokoro (traditional dug-out canoe) excursions in the open, shallow floodplains as well as boating and walking.

name: Great Plains Conservation Duba Explorers Camp
description: Duba Explorers Camp is a wildlife connoisseur’s getaway; situated on an island in the northern reaches of the 33,000 hectare Duba concession and surrounded on all sides by pristine Okavango Delta. This intimate camp, with its own private traversing area within the concession and away from that of Duba Plains Camp, consists of five expedition-style tents of light airy canvas on slightly raised decking, each with views of the surrounding floodplain. Each tent is stylishly furnished and designed by Great Plains Conservation Founders and National Geographic Explorers-in-Residence Dereck and Beverly Joubert, using their unique sensibilities to capture a spirit of exploration. Each room has a campaign writing desk and private verandah as well as en-suite facilities consisting of flush loo, double vanities, and indoor shower. Fans and open-air design maintain a comfortable climate for rest and relaxation. The main area is open-air, under sweeping marquee canvas, on raised decking and consists of an open-concept dining and lounge area. Duba Explorers Camp prides itself on its extraordinary wildlife experiences, and rightly so. Guests of the camp enjoy regular sightings of a diverse range of species, including lechwe, kudu, tsessebe, and giraffe. Herds of elephants and buffalo move around the camp and hippo trudge through the swamps creating their channels and paths daily. Lions, leopards and even African wild (painted) dogs are spotted regularly. Birds abound, and the area is a birdwatcher’s paradise. Enjoy guided walks, mekoro and boating opportunities or early morning and late afternoon wildlife drives and revel in ​one of the most stunning and varied wildlife areas in the world.

name: Golden Door Villa
description:
Finding an ideal family-friendly guest house in Gaborone does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Golden Door Villa, a nice option for travelers like you.
While staying at Golden Door Villa, visitors can check out Three Chiefs' Statues (2.7 mi), which is a popular Gaborone attraction.
Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at Golden Door Villa offer air conditioning, a desk, and a seating area.
During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a 24 hour front desk and baggage storage. Guests of Golden Door Villa are also welcome to enjoy a pool and barbeque facilities, located on site. For travelers arriving by car, free parking is available.
Travelers looking for sushi restaurants can head to China Restaurant, Rhapsody's Gaborone, or Ocean Basket.
Best of all, Golden Door Villa makes it easy to experience some great Gaborone attractions like National Assembly Building, which is a popular government building.
Golden Door Villa looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Gaborone.

name: Dqae Qare San Lodge
description: Dqae Qare is owned and run by the San (Bushmen). The lodge is situated on a 7500 game reserve well stocked with game while the San offer a wide range of authentic cultural activities including bush walks to show their amazing knowledge of the Kalahari, traditional healing dances at night around a fire, fire making, craft making, trap setting and story telling. The lodge has six old farmhouse en suite rooms, one Honeymoon Suite, one double room and eight twin rooms and an extensive campsite under Camel thorn trees. The San are renowned for their friendly and welcoming nature and you will truly experience this here, on their own farm!

name: Falcon Crest Suites
description: A 5* Boutique guest house centrally located in Gaborone at Plot 2571, Nyerere Drive and Nyerere Drive shopping centers,and the National stadium. The vibe of this 5* Guest house is one of homely elegance rather than imposing grandeur. Eight individually decorated en-suite bedrooms, five jacuzzi baths and three Victorian baths. Located in carefully manicured gardens,, the main house is sumptuous with a wooden carved spiral staircase leading to the ground floor. All rooms are air conditioned, have TVs, mini bars and have internet access. Room rates include continental breakfast. Falconry restaurant offers a full a' la carte menu throughout the day as well as variety of coffees, teas and daily made cakes. Adjacent to the Falconry restaurant, is a patio surrounded by lush garden. The patio offers light and quick meals moderately priced. The restaurant is open seven days a week from 0700hres to 2200hrs. There is a private dinning room which caters for two to eight people. Outside catering is available for any occasion, weddings, cocktail parties, private lunches and dinners as well as board meetings. Two fully air conditioned conference rooms which can accommodate up to 16 and 30 participants respectively and two meeting rooms for smaller groups. Projectors are also available on request. The blend of professional and classy decor creates the ideal place to impress clients.

name: Wilderness Kalahari Plains Camp
locationString: Central Kalahari Game Reserve, Ghanzi District
description: Endless skies, ancient cultures, abundant summers and insightful winters.Kalahari Plains Camp, overlooking an immense grassy and fertile pan with endless horizons and beautiful skies, is raised off the ground to catch the breeze and take in sweeping views across the Kalahari by day and star-filled skies by night. Solar power provides electricity and hot water, and innovative insulated canvas walls and roof keep the temperatures inside comfortable. The lounge and dining area, also raised, are perfect for watching wildlife in front of camp. HighlightsThe Central Kalahari Game Reserve is famed for its outstanding wildlife. This region offers some of the best summer wildlife viewing in Africa; the desert springs to life attracting vast herds of antelope (principally springbok, gemsbok, red hartebeest and blue wildebeest) followed by abundant predators – including the legendary black-maned Kalahari lion and cheetah, offering perhaps Botswana’s best viewing of this species. The unique culture and traditional lifestyles of the San Bushman people are celebrated here by San staff from the area.10 Tents (including 2 Family Tents): En-suite canvas units; rooftop sleep-out areaExperiences: Morning and afternoon game drives Guided nature walks San Bushman experience Day trips to Deception Valley

There is ample space for children in the purpose-built family suites – including a built-in 'tree-house' and an elevated deck which has its own small swimming pool and sandpit.HighlightsThe large elephant population aside, a growing abundance of game graces the area: giraffe, zebra, impala, wildebeest, tsessebe and lechwe. name: Shinde Footsteps - Ker & Downey Botswana
description: Footsteps Camp is home to Footsteps Across The Delta (Walking Safari) and Young Explorers (Family Safari). On a Footsteps Across The Delta walking safari you enter one of the great, untamed regions of Africa: the spectacular Okavango Delta. Experience the astonishing contrasts created when the mighty Okavango River flows into the arid Kalahari Desert - the result is a variety of habitats, riverine forest, palm islands, permanent swamps and dry sandveld all with an unparalleled wealth of animal diversity. This safari maintains the elegance and eccentricity of the original ‘under canvas African safari’. The emphasis is on exploring this breathtakingly beautiful and diverse environment as the first African explorers did, either on foot or by Mokoro (depending on water levels). The Young Explorers safari is a specially designed programme which offers families the opportunity to discover the wonders of the African wilderness - together. One of the special attractions of this safari is its exclusivity. Each family has the use of the Footsteps Camp a private six bedded camp, a professional guide, personal chef, waiter, housekeeper and dedicated Mokoro guides. It literally allows guests to explore the bush at their leisure, while never losing sight of the fact that being in the wilderness is also about having fun!

name: andBeyond Savute Under Canvas
description: Rates from USD 500 per person per night. Savute, a remote and wild corner of Chobe National Park, stretches from the park’s northern boundaries to the Linyanti River. It’s named after the enigmatic Savute Channel, which flows and dries up intermittently, seemingly unrelated to rainfall: it flowed in 2009, again in 2013 and no-one can say when it will flow again. Savute Under Canvas is a mobile camp carefully positioned close to this channel which feeds into the Savute Marsh, home to exceptional numbers of elephant-hunting lion. Situated within the unique and haunting Savute landscape, our exclusive mobile campsites are perfectly situated to explore this remote region. The common guest area comprises open-sided tents for dining, pre-dinner drinks, or simply whiling away the time between game viewing adventures with a good book and a frosted beer or glass of wine. Delicious meals cooked over the coals are shared around a blazing fire. You’ll love the spaciousness of our mobile tents. Each of the five canvas tents boasts a comfortable double or twin bed, as well as an ensuite bathroom, separate flush WC and an outdoor bucket shower – steaming hot water is available on request. A private butler is on hand to assist with any requirements. Live this real-life adventure, immersed in the wild world of Savute.

Our location is about a 5 minute drive from the town center, which provides easy access to all the shops and facilities. We are on the main road leading to and from Moremi Game Reserve, Nxai Pan and the Central Kalahari Game Reserve. The famous Okavango Delta is on our doorstep. If you are looking for comfort, modern amenities and a good night's sleep - then Queness Inn is the place for you!

Daytrips to the Tsodilo hills, Unesco World Heritage, and to the Mahango Game Reserve (in Namibia, 30min drive) are also on the lodge's to do list... Not to mention our Italian cook's specialities!

name: Linyanti Expeditions
description: Experience a life-changing safari at our seasonal camp located on the southern banks of the Linyanti River in northern Botswana. Linyanti Wilderness Reserve is a private concession boasting splendid scenery of untouched grasslands, riverine forest and meandering lagoons. The sumptuous style belies the simplicity of the camp. Organic layers with a comfortable lived-in feel are imbued with elegant touches of copper and cut-glass add a dash of old-world charm. Underscored by our ethos of eco-sensitivity, this Linyanti safari lodge touches the earth lightly. With only 6 tents, the camp has an intimate atmosphere, ensuring a personalized service for each guest. The main area has two canvas-covered hubs; a dining area with an exposed kitchen and an open lounge. As with most of our camps, the campfire is at the centre, drawing guests to enjoy the authentic experience of the African bush outside. The location of our Linyanti safari lodge in the northern region of Botswana enjoys an abundance of wildlife. The area is frequented by vast herds of elephant, buffalo and zebra that attract iconic predators such as lion, leopard, cheetah and wild dogs.

description: Breath-taking Mboma Island Expeditions Camp is a piece of pristine paradise located in one of three remote campsite area's on the tip of the game rich Moremi Game Reserve. Based out of Mboma Island on the floodplains of the meeting point of the Delta’s fresh waters and the Moremi’s savannah terrain, means that Mboma is ideal for both land and water based safaris. An opportunity for guests to enjoy a charming African authenticity in a mobile camp that promises to deliver a wild experience in the Okavango Delta. This magical mobile camp has 5 light Meru-style canvas tents equipped with twin beds and en suite, open-air bathrooms. Everything about this camp is eco-friendly, from the sole use of solar-power, to bucket showers, and Eco toilets. Tents are fully furnished using the finest linen and kitted out in the creature comforts from home. Decor is in perfect harmony with the surrounds - neutral tones are interrupted by bold pops of colour that reflect the colourful spirit of Botswana. The Meru tents are joined by a network of lantern-lined pathways, and the main areas include a boma, safari dining tent and lounge, all quintessential elements of a classic safari.

name: Kwalape Safari Lodge
description: Situated between Botswana’s northern towns of Kazungula and Kasane, Kwalape Safari Lodge offers the perfect base to discover the wonders of Chobe National Park and River, with its vast elephant herds and wildlife populations. Kwalape is only an hour away from the magnificent Victoria Falls and 1 km away from where four great African countries meet (Namibia, Zambia, Zimbabwe and Botswana) making Kwalape an ideal location to explore from. Kwalape means ‘at home’ in Setswana and it is our management philosophy for all guests to feel welcome, relaxed and at home during their stay and to leave us as friends. We offer value for money accommodation with excellent service. Constructed of canvas, wood and thatch, in harmony with its luscious and naturally landscaped surroundings, Kwalape Lodge comprises 12 chalets each with spacious living areas, en-suite bathroom facilities and a private veranda; 12 safari tents and camping facilities for overland and private tours. The main restaurant and bar are thatched and nestled into the surrounding bush with the restaurant bar offering a stunning elevated deck, ideal for sun downers and sharing the day’s experience with other guests. Other facilities include a swimming pool, conference facility and Boma for starlight meals.

name: Amber River Camp - Okavango Hidden Gems
description: Located on a secluded concession in the southern region of the Okavango Delta, Amber River Camp is situated on a permanent water channel, bordering the Moremi Game Reserve. This concession offers an exciting, game-rich safari experience with year-round game drives and water activities. The design of Amber River Camp is a deliberate return to the authentic safari camps of days gone by and, with just 6 luxurious tented suites, it offers o ne of the most intimate and exclusive safari experiences available in the Delta. The Camp is shaded by a grove of giant Leadwood trees on the edge of an expansive lagoon, filled with grunting hippos and fringed with waving papyrus. This permanent water sour ce attracts many animals and birds, both great and small. The main guest areas include an open-air dining tent, a comfortable lounge area known as the “Map Room”, a congenial bar area, and a fire pit - all with views over the lagoon. The unique multi-layered design of the tented bedrooms means that the inside temperature is several degrees cooler than the outside temperature. The bedrooms offer a choice of twin or king-sized extra-length beds with mosquito nets, uniquely stylish safari furniture and a private veranda. The en-suite inside bathrooms offer his ‘n hers hot water showers, double basins and a flush toilet. The rooms also have a private outdoor bathroom, complete with an outside shower and a luxury bath tub for bathing under the stars. Amber River Camp provides a complete Delta experience, with a wide variety of activities : game drives , guided bush walks and mokoro trips.
address: Amber River Camp, Maun, Ngamiland East Botswana

Or try out our new Meru Tents located in a beautifully shaded area. Perfect for campers that are tired of setting up their tent and are looking for that extra bit of comfort and privacy. Sitatunga Camp has a great setting and you can relax in our bar and restaurant (free wifi)and make use of our swimming pool. The campsite offers large well shaded areas with powered (220v) sites and bbq / braai facilities.There are two shared ablution blocks. The campsite has security guards employed on a full time basis. Predominantly our business caters for the overlanders so come and enjoy some beers and tell some stories. We also offer Mokoro safaris and day trips in to the Okavango and Mobile Safaris and day trips to National Parks. Other activities include Scenic Flight, Helicopter or Fixed wing aircraft, Horse riding and sunset boat cruises(seasonal)

name: Modisa Wildlife Project
description: Mikkel Legarth from Denmark and Valentin Gruener from Germany founded Modisa Wildlife Project in 2010 - a project with the ambition of creating awareness and preserving the Kalahari ecosystem and its predators. Modisa's aim is to engage in the conservation of the Kalahari ecosystem by promoting awareness at the local and global scale, assisting in the mitigation of human-carnivore conflict, and providing support to researchers. You can be part of our conservation work and get close-up encounters with Africa's most iconic animals while meeting new friends from all over the world. HIGHLIGHTS: - Lectures on Botswana's history, wildlife, and ecosystems - Camp maintenance - Walking in the wilderness with specialized guide. - Camping in the African bush under the breathtaking Kalahari sky* - Up-close encounters with big cats and other local predators - Feeding lions, leopards, and African wild dogs - Cleaning the enclosures and fence maintenance - Basic tracking training on bush walks - Animal viewing - Game drives - Enjoying the adventure with like-minded people from all over the world *Once a month during the dry season (May - October) depending on weather. To be guaranteed this experience you need to book minimum 4 weeks.
address: P.bag 114, Suite 3, Maun, Ngamiland East Botswana

name: Phofu Kalahari Lodge
description: Phofu Kalahari Lodge is a uniquely designed luxurious lodge along the Trans-Kalahari highway, 52 km’s from Kang on the southern border of the five million hectare Central Kalahari Game Park. Phofu surprises visitors that are used to the best of the best! You can legally enter the CKGR from our 6000 ha farm providing that you have all the necessary documentation at hand. Phofu is a perfect stopover for tourists travelling to and from Namibia, Maun & destinations in and around the CKGR. From luxury accommodation to a basic bush campsite, we cater for all visitors wanting to explore the beauty of Botswana. Phofu is a place where you can enjoy a quiet and tranquil space, where the only noise you can hear is the campfire, wildlife and birds. All the rooms and luxury tents have a beautiful view of the waterhole where animals come to drink. Take a dip in the pool, a guided walk, bird viewing, play snooker, enjoy a sundowner at the viewing points. Phofu is a birds viewers paradise.

name: Swamp Stop Okavango River Camp
description: Swamp Stop River Camp is an original, authentic Delta camp that is a locals favorite. Renowned for its charm, great food and excellent scenery, it is situated dramatically on the Okavango River, 50km south of Mohembo, and 330km North of Maun on the Shakawe road. It offers 12 excellently priced, airconditioned, clean rooms with ensuite bath, shower and toilet, together with minibar and bbq facilities. We also have a large campsite with toilets and showers. Our central bar area serves ice cold beer and a family style menu inlcuding english breakfast, burgers, BLT's, and steaks and more. We have a revamped fleet of boats available for doing transfers to Seronga or day trips for fishing or to nearby islands. Our flagship boat "Loose Goose" take about 20 guests and is perfect for sundowner cruises. We also offer trips into the Okavango Delta where guests can overnight at an affordable Tented Camp on a Private island that features ensuite acomodations in Safari Tents where guests can either opt for self catered meals or full board meals.

name: Cycad Palm Guesthouse
description:
Everyone needs a place to lay their weary head. For travelers visiting Gaborone, Cycad Palm Guesthouse is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation. Well-known for its family-friendly environment and proximity to great restaurants, Cycad Palm Guesthouse makes it easy to enjoy the best of Gaborone.
Rooms at Cycad Palm Guesthouse provide air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a seating area, and guests can stay connected with free wifi.
In addition, while staying at Cycad Palm Guesthouse guests have access to a 24 hour front desk, baggage storage, and executive lounge access. You can also enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant. Need a place to park? Free parking is available at Cycad Palm Guesthouse.
While in Gaborone be sure to experience nearby barbeque restaurants such as Bull & Bush Pub.
During your visit, be sure to check out a popular government building like National Assembly Building, which is a short distance from the small hotel.
Cycad Palm Guesthouse is sure to make your visit to Gaborone one worth remembering.

name: Earth Bed And Breakfast
description:
Looking for a place to stay in Gaborone? Then look no further than Earth Bed And Breakfast, a guest house that brings the best of Gaborone to your doorstep.
Guest rooms offer air conditioning, and Earth Bed And Breakfast makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.
You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the guest house, including a 24 hour front desk, room service, and baggage storage. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and barbeque facilities during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.
Nearby landmarks such as Jamia Mosque (2.0 mi) and Trinity Church (2.4 mi) make Earth Bed And Breakfast a great place to stay when visiting Gaborone.
During your visit, be sure to check out a popular Gaborone lobster restaurant such as Caravela Portuguese Restaurant, which is a short distance from Earth Bed And Breakfast.
If you’re looking for something to do, Somarelang Tikologo (Environment Watch Botswana) is a nice way to spend some time.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Earth Bed And Breakfast as you experience everything Gaborone has to offer.
address: Lerala 12707 Broadhurst Taung, Gaborone Botswana

roomTips.text: We stayed in the spacious executive suite and it was a joy to have stayed there.

name: Kamanga Safari Hotel
description:
Everyone needs a place to lay their weary head. For travelers visiting Maun, Kamanga Safari Hotel is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation. Well-known for its romantic environment and proximity to great restaurants, Kamanga Safari Hotel makes it easy to enjoy the best of Maun.
Kamanga Safari Hotel is a romantic small hotel offering air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a kitchenette in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.
The small hotel features a 24 hour front desk and room service. Plus, guests can enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant, which have made this a popular choice among travelers visiting Maun. For guests with a vehicle, free parking is available.
While you’re here, be sure to check out Chutney Restaurant, one of the Asian restaurants that can be found in Maun, which is a short distance from Kamanga Safari Hotel.
Kamanga Safari Hotel is sure to make your visit to Maun one worth remembering.
address: Plot 1471 Old Matlapaneng Bridge, Maun, Ngamiland East Botswana

name: Masama Lodge and Camp Site
description: Masama lodge and camp site is real bush camp in the gateway of Serowe village it is a good stop over for 4x4 vehicle to the deltas out and in. We are located on A14 highway. We have in suite limited chalets. The facility is built on a unique slope of a sand stone called MASAMA. Masama Lodge and camp site is a full citizen private limited company incorporated in Botswana since February 2000 with special business interest focused in the promotion of local, regional and overseas tourists activities. Different aspects of traditional and changing cultural values in Botswana including living styles, sports, theater, crafts, music and dancing. Masama Lodge and camp site is situated in and around sand stone protrusion that constitutes Swaneng Hills at 9 km from Serowe and about 700 km from Pretoria this therefore makes it a good stop over for people to the Deltas and far from South. The surrounding terrain scopes generally away from this protrusion id dominantly thorn veld.

name: Elephant Bush Camp
description: The Elephant Bush Camp is a seasonal tented camp on the boundary of the Okavango Delta. Our camp is a simple affair set on the banks of a lagoon on a finger of the Gomoti River. We make no claims at being luxurious - just old school simple, comfortable and affordable for those wanting a taste of the Okavango and the African Bush. We have 12 comfortable twin bedded tents with a bush en-suite bathroom - long drop loos and bucket showers. The Elephant Bush Camp employees staff locally in the way of all mokoro safaris, they are not botanists, ornithologists or naturalists but they have a great respect for their Delta home and are proud to be able to share both the area and their experiences of living in this beautiful place with you. Meals are included and a simple bar is operated at the camp. Activities include walks and mokoro trails and there are canoes at camp for paddling in the lagoon. Transport to camp depends on water levels and may involve a combination of 4x4 vehicle, motorboat or mokoro. For those seeking further adventure a helicopter flight to camp can be arranged

name: Blue Olive Bed & Breakfast
description:
Blue Olive Bed & Breakfast is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Gaborone, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.
Close to some of Gaborone's most popular landmarks, such as ISKCON Gaborone (1.5 mi) and Trinity Church (2.2 mi), Blue Olive Bed & Breakfast is a great destination for tourists.
Guest rooms offer air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a desk, and Blue Olive Bed & Breakfast makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.
You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the bed and breakfast, including outdoor furniture. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.
Gaborone has plenty of Italian restaurants. So when you’re here, be sure to check out popular spots like BASILICO - Italian restaurant, Cappuccino's, and Delis, which are serving up some great dishes.
Best of all, Blue Olive Bed & Breakfast makes it easy to experience some great Gaborone attractions like National Assembly Building, which is a popular government building.
Enjoy your stay in Gaborone!

Guests of Oppi-Koppi B&B are also welcome to enjoy a lounge, located on site.
Given the close proximity to Jamia Mosque (1.7 mi), guests of Oppi-Koppi B&B can easily experience one of Gaborone's most popular landmarks.
Travelers looking to enjoy some lobster can head to Caravela Portuguese Restaurant. Otherwise, you may want to check out a Mediterranean restaurant such as Caravela Portuguese Restaurant.
If you are interested in exploring Gaborone, check out one of the monuments and statues, such as Three Chiefs' Statues and National Assembly Building.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Oppi-Koppi B&B as you experience everything Gaborone has to offer.

Tshimologo offers superb holiday and break-a-way opportunities to you. Tshimologo in Setswana means A BEGINNING. This will be a beginning of a fabulous relationship between the Guest House and all our wonderful customers. Tshimologo Farm Guest House is located in the heart of the bush but is only a twenty minute drive from Francistown. The fresh air and the sound of birds singing in the spacious garden will help you to relax and rejuvenate your batteries. The warmest hospitality awaits you at Tshimologo Farm Guesthouse, which is owned and personally managed by Eileen. As she has a tremendous interest in people from all walks of life, she will go out of her way to make her guests feel welcome and comfortable. Eileen enjoys sharing her home and its beautiful surroundings with people from all over the world. Tshimologo Farm Guesthouse is an establishment that is renowned for their delicious meals warm-hearted hospitality, friendly staff and comfortable accommodation. Eileen will provide a hearty full farm breakfast. Dinner is provided on request and is buffet style being served in the dining room. A packed lunch box may also be provided on request.

name: Bridgetown Resort
description: Experience Chobe in Luxury with the new Bridgetown Resort. Come and soak in the sun and relax in this beautiful new resort situated between the Northern Botswana towns of Kasane and Kazungula. Bridgetown Resort centrally near the point where the four countries of Botswana, Namibia, Zambia and Zimbabwe meet and within easy distance of the Natural Wonders and beautiful sites of these countries...Chobe Game Reserve, Impalila Island, the Chobe and Zambezi Rivers, the Voctoria Falls and the Caprivi Flood Plains... Accommodation at Bridgetwon Resort comprises 10 Luxury Suites, all River Facing, and 26 De-Lux Rooms with en-suite facilities, with 13 of the De-Lux Rooms are North Facing with views of the Chobe-Zambezi River basin and 13 are facing South with views of the Kasane Forest, read more... Facilities at Bridgetown Resort consist of a themed main restaurant, a lounge bar and swimming pool, in room Spa Treatments, Activity Centre, and a Curio Shop, read more...

name: Echo Lodge
description: Echo Lodge is in Kang village in Botswana along the trans Kalahari Highway midway between Ramatlabama and Mamuno border posts. Kang village is home of the San/Basarwa/Bushmen and the Bakgalagari people. main activity is farming Our facilities include 3 twin bed rooms (sleeps 2 together and 1 on the other bed) and 7 one bed rooms (sleeps 2 in one bed) in chalets. Total beds therefore are 13. All rooms are : - air conditioned - have full satelite TV decoders each with 34 channels to give you variety of entertainment. - have a shower - have a bar fridge - have tea/coffee making facilities - a reading lamp - a closet - a work table In addition we have: - a conference hall with capacity of 60 people - a restaurant with capacity of 70 people. Our restaurant serves traditional as well as standard menus. - a cocktail bar - outdoor sitting - a medium sized swimming pool - WIFI -laundry facilities - a braai/barbecue area and fireplace There is an airstrip on the eastern part of the village.

Choose one or more of 25 air conditioned Executive, Business or Luxury Suites. All with king sized beds and en-suite bathrooms with walk in double showers or bath tubs and heated towel rails. Enjoy the complimentary WIFI, amenities and in-room tea/coffee while charging your gadgets on USB port sockets. These are some of the highlights our guests have come to love about us. Our chefs are always keen to tantalise you with their delectable cuisine. You can enjoy the news/movies/music/sports on the 3 big screens in the restaurant while chatting with our friendly waiters over your starters or drinks. We can seat 40 guests in the restaurant and 12 at the bar. Or you can order room service-our beds are hard to get out of! We can arrange for a game drive at Khama Rhino Sanctuary which is a 20 minutes drive away.
